result.execSummary:
The defendant Nathaneal Cruz Patterson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Damage to Property (Less Than $2,500 Damage), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Court ordered defendant provide a DNA sample and pay the DNA surcharges as to both cases.
Court waived non-mandatory court costs due to defendant's indigency. As to mandatory court costs, surcharges and assessment including the DNA surcharges to be paid by 2/22/2024, to convert to a civil judgment.
Court set restitution at zero for both cases.

charges.descr: Criminal Damage to Property (Less Than $2,500 Damage)

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Nathaneal Cruz Patterson

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Nathaneal Cruz Patterson in court with attorney Ruby De Leon.  Defendant Nathaneal Cruz Patterson in custody.  Thomas Hasle appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case proceeded to plea and sentencing with case 21CT1774.
Parties have reached a resolution in this matter.
Plea hearing proceeded. Negotiations placed on the record and confirmed by defense counsel and defendant.
As to Count 1:
Defendant changes his/her plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his/her plea, advised of his/her Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his/her rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, jury instructions/elements and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.
*
Sentencing hearing proceeded with statements from state, defense and defendant.
The Court ordered the Defendant to:
As to case 21CT1774:
- Serve 87 days in the House of Correction, consecutive to 21CF1177 and any other sentence with credit for 29 days time served.
As to case 22CM1010:
- Serve 13 days in the House of Correction, concurrent with 21CF1177.

As to 21CT1774:
Court further ordered:
- Fine of $600.00 plus costs, fees and assessments
- 24 months drivers license revocation.
- 24 months ignition interlock.
- AODA assessment.

Court set restitution at zero as to both cases.
Court ordered defendant provide a DNA sample and pay the DNA surcharges as to both cases.

Court waived non-mandatory court costs due to defendant's indigency.   As to mandatory court costs, surcharges and assessment  (including the DNA surcharges) to be paid by 2/22/2024, to convert to a civil judgment. 

Appeal rights given

Defendant Nathaneal Cruz Patterson in court with attorney Ruby De Leon.  Defendant Nathaneal Cruz Patterson in custody.  Nate Kristian McClure appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for scheduled plea and sentencing hearing. Case in court with 21CT1774. Defendant has a pending Oak Creek case related to 21CT1774.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Reserve Branch 13.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 22, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Addendum to plea questionnaire waiver of rights, Received and Filed.

Attorney Ruby De Leon in court, defendant Nathaneal Cruz Patterson not in court, in custody.  Nate Kristian McClure appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney appeared by video means.   Defense counsel has received an offer and requests additional time to review.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 37.   All parties are advised effective August 1, 2022 this case will be assigned to a Branch of RESERVE JUDGES.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 16, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Attorney Ruby De Leon in court, defendant Nathaneal Cruz Patterson not in court, in custody.  Thomas Hasle appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel to receive discovery and offer and requests additional time to review.  Attorney De Leon and SPD Findling to resolve attorney representation.   Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 37.   This hearing may be streamed live on Dacast at the Court's discretion:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/3c595ccd-39e3-09d4-8db1-82162d766d4f  Status conference scheduled for June 9, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with M.R.P. and C.R.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 4.  The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.  Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.

Defendant Nathaneal Cruz Patterson in court with attorney Travis Schwantes.  Defendant Nathaneal Cruz Patterson in custody.  Claire Louise Starling appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Nathaneal Cruz Patterson appeared by video means with Attorney.  Case retabbed to Branch 37 Lower number case pending.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dee, Branch 37.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/3c595ccd-39e3-09d4-8db1-82162d766d4f  Status conference scheduled for May 24, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
